byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and NIKITA STEWART

abstract: Panel recommends series of pay raises for New York City's elected officials, including 15 percent raise for Mayor Bill de Blasio, to $258,750; de Blasio has said he will not accept pay increase during his first term in office; panel also recommends that City Council seats be classified as full-time jobs so that occupants will not be tempted to seek outside employment.
lead_paragraph: Citing increases in the cost of living, a commission has suggested increases ranging from 12 percent to 23 percent for the mayor, City Council members and others.

headline.main: New York City’s Elected Officials Should Get Raises, Panel Says
headline.print_headline: Board Endorses Raises for City’s Elected Officials

snippet: Citing increases in the cost of living, a commission has suggested increases ranging from 12 percent to 23 percent for the mayor, City Council members and others.
